conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine motion direction.
Velocity is positive above the t-axis and negative below the t-axis.
At t = 2 seconds, velocity is 0 m/s as the graph intersects the t-axis.
From t = 2 to t = 3 seconds, velocity is below the t-axis, indicating it is negative.
Negative velocity indicates motion opposite to the defined positive direction.
Between 2 to 3 seconds, the particle's motion direction is opposite to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
